R-stats Code

This is my blog for programming in R-stats (and occasionally other languages). I am interested in mapping, GIS, simulation modelling, statistics, optimization and visualisation, mainly for the biological sciences, but many of the applications are general. I hope you find them useful.

If you are interested in my courses feel free to download and share them. You are welcome to use them for your own teaching, and I would love to hear about it. If you would like me to come and teach one of these courses at your institution, then get in touch!

Download one of my free R courses

  1. Data Wrangling and Analysis in R for Marine Scientists (Nov 2015)
  2. Data Wrangling in R (June 2015) (or download the course and data)
  3. Maps and GIS in R (June 2015)

More code (including this webpage) is on my Github page.
